anecdotes.content: If it hurts, do it more often
Adding manpower to a late software project makes it later!
The first 90 percent of the code accounts for the first 90 percent of the development time...The remaining 10 percent of the code accounts for the other 90 percent of the development time.
Any fool can write code that a computer can understand. Good programmers write code that humans can understand.
Premature optimization is the root of all evil.
Debugging is twice as hard as writing the code in the first place. Therefore, if you write the code as cleverly as possible, you are, by definition, not smart enough to debug it.
I like talking to myself. It is one of my greatest pleasures. I often have long conversations all by myself, and I am so clever sometimes I don't understand a single word of what I am saying.
You know, when I was a kid, my dog was my best friend. My childhood was better because of him.
I was an owl last yearâ€”it was a real hoot!
I would rather be an artist than a leader. Ironically, a leader has to follow the rules
A friend is not the shadow that mimics you, but the one who casts all shadows away
The best of who you are is not from who you have in your life, rather who they helped you become because they loved you
A clever person solves a problem.
Programming today is a race between software engineers striving to build bigger and better idiot-proof programs, and the Universe trying to produce bigger and better idiots.
